SoftEther ist eine Open Source Software die OpenVPN, IPsec, L2TP, MS-SSTP, L2TPv3 und EtherIP beherrscht und eignet sich perfekt f√ºr einen VPN Server.

Installation : Voraussetzungen installieren 

apt-get install gcc gcc-multilib
Software Downloaden http://www.softether-download.com/en.aspx?product=softether

Installation 

tar zxf softether-vpnserver-v1.00-9029-rc2-2013.03.16-linux-x64-64bit.tar.gz
cd vpnserver
make
cd ..
mv vpnserver /usr/local
cd /usr/local/vpnserver/
chmod 600 *
chmod 700 vpncmd
chmod 700 vpnserver
nano /etc/init.d/vpnserver

init Start erstellen 

#!/bin/sh
### BEGIN INIT INFO
# Provides:          vpnserver
# Required-Start:    $remote_fs $syslog
# Required-Stop:     $remote_fs $syslog
# Default-Start:     2 3 4 5
# Default-Stop:      0 1 6
# Short-Description: Start daemon at boot time
# Description:       Enable Softether by daemon.
### END INIT INFO
DAEMON=/usr/local/vpnserver/vpnserver
LOCK=/var/lock/subsys/vpnserver
test -x $DAEMON || exit 0
case "$1" in
start)
$DAEMON start
touch $LOCK
;;
stop)
$DAEMON stop
rm $LOCK
;;
restart)
$DAEMON stop
sleep 3
$DAEMON start
;;
*)
echo "Usage: $0 {start|stop|restart}"
exit 1
esac
exit 0

Service aktivieren : 

chmod 755 /etc/init.d/vpnserver
mkdir /var/lock/subsys
update-rc.d vpnserver defaults
/etc/init.d/vpnserver start
cd /usr/local/vpnserver/

Checken 

./vpncmd
3
check

Password setzen 

./vpncmd
1
ret
